intro: Mallotus caput-medusae, commonly known as the crown-of-thorns or flame of the forest, is a striking shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its dense, spiny branches and clusters of bright red or orange flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has compound leaves with numerous small leaflets and produces woody, cone-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in coastal or disturbed areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and landscapes worldwide.
